Package de.stock.tradeable

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ITradable
    Interface for tradeables

    Tradables, which are stored in the TradableHandler, consist of several parts:

    - The value
      Every tradeable has a value at what cost the player can buy one
      The value gets influenced by events respectively environments.
      If a tradeable wasn't influenced by an event the TradableHandler updates the value manually
      using a random value in between the influencable bottom bound and the influencable top bound of the tradeable every round.

    - The shares
      Every tradeable has a number of minimum and maximum available shares.
      The number of shares is initialized with ITradable.initializeShares()
      This number varies if the player buys or sells a tradeable.
      (It should change randomly without the players influence, too)

    - The environment
      Every tradeable is part of one or more environments.
      Example: Wheat is part of the Group cereal

    A tradeable is from type Stock, Commodity, Forex or Derivate and a developer must instantiate from these classes.
    He must not instantiate the Tradable class!

    Its the key element to earn money in this game.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Commodity
    See ITradable for further information on tradeables
    Derivate
    Not implemented!

    A derivate is a bet
    Example derivate: The oil price drops by 15$ the next round - If the oil price drops, you get wonga.
    Forex
    See ITradable for further information on tradeables
    Stock
    See ITradable for further information on tradeables
    Tradable
    See ITradable for further information
    TradableHandler
    The tradeable handler stores all registered tradeables, keeps track of the active (currently played) tradeables and updates them if they weren't influenced by an Event
